description: An ancient Phoenician settlement located in western Sardinia on a promontory in the Gulf of Oristano, just south of modern San Giovanni di Sinis. While it originates as a Punic or Carthaginian settlement ca. 700 BCE, it continued as a major town in Roman times.
details:
The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: S. Giovanni di Sinis

 
Smith 1857 (2.1135) emphasizes that the site is mentioned by Ptolemy as Tarrae or Tarras and also in the Antonine Itineraries, which place it 12 miles from Othoca.

add ToposText reference provided by bkiesling

names.description: One of two variants Ptolemy provides for the ancient name of Tharros (mod. S. Giovanni di Sinis on Sardinia).
